channel.title: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
channel.description:
So some of you may remember Blizzard sued the wow bot Glider which operated under an American company, and was successful in stopping sales, distribution and got some crazy ruling about DMCA and circumvention of warden.
Now they've gone and sued the (currently) best bot on the market Honorbuddy which operates under a company in Germany (yes, that means filing the lawsuit in Germany itself, too - gl/hf DMCA) which may have quite a few implications depending on what Blizzard are seeking damages for. There's a touch more info on their [url=http://www.thebuddyforum.com/legal/]forums[/url], however not much more than the fact that the suit was filed under reference 310 O 260/11 on 11/07/2011 before the District Court of Hamburg, and the details are not yet available.
Bot licences are still being sold, however their model has changed slightly - they no longer sell 'lifetime' licences under the guise of not being misleading - heh. Other than that it seems business as usual, at least until all the details of the case are disclosed.
You'll probably see (some) mainstream media pick up on this more once these details are forthcoming.

item.title: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

What sort of demands does Blizzard have in the event that HB loses? I reckon a large compensation etc.?

Read full topic
item.source: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany

item.title: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You’d need loads though, one for each jurisdiction. And why don’t we have vehicle courts, or engineering courts, or banking courts, or any other specialty courts?

This is why we have lawyers, really. (Who often do have specializations.)

Read full topic
item.source: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany

item.title: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:3, topic:405391”]Why don’t they have an internet court so to speak with more technically savvy lawyers/judges and such?[/quote]This is a good idea. Cyber crime is huge but most of the judges dealing with these big cases weren’t even learning about that stuff when they were in school. It takes a LONG time to work up that ladder…I wouldn’t be surprised if a lot of them are very comfortable with a Commodore 64.

Read full topic
item.source: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany

item.source: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany

item.title: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Interesting. Not quite “GF DMCA” since unfortunately a lot of American influence has crept into EU law and we’re basically as bad over here as they are now. As much as I’m not a fan of HB, I hope it goes well for them, since we all remember what a ridiculous farce the Glider case was. Nobody deserves to lose a court case on a bunch of lies and misled non-technically minded officials.

EDIT: Also its good of them to stop selling lifetime licences knowing their life might not be very much longer. Many wouldn’t.

Read full topic
item.source: Blizzard sues another bot ... in Germany
